intro: Draba crassa, commonly known as the broadleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, followed by narrow, elongated seed pods. Draba crassa is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
